content: Yes, that's true! Many species of kingfishers are known for their loud and distinctive calls. In fact, some kingfishers have calls that can be heard from over half a mile away! These calls are used for a variety of reasons, including to defend territory, attract mates, and communicate with other members of their species. The call of the Belted kingfisher, for example, is a rattling, harsh call that sounds like a dry rattle or machine gun.
